name: Affinia 50

reviews.text: We stayed in a one bedroom suite for 5 nights and absolutely loved it. There was an unbelievable amount of room in the living/dining area and a fully-equipped separate kitchen. The staff was very friendly and helpful. During the week, we enjoyed complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings. The location is perfect and walkable to virtually every attraction in New York. And, if you don't care to walk, there is a subway with 3 lines just a block away. Around the corner is a terrific deli/quick stop that has an incredible selection of hot foods 24 hours a day. I will definitely stay at the Affinia 50 when I return to New York.
reviews.title: Terrific Stay!
Great Hotel in Great Location
reviews.text: Syayed with two colleagues on Sun 25th and Mon 26th.

reviews.title: Great Place in NY
reviews.text: Very friendly staff ,rooms very nice (Had a Junior Suite) . Location excellent for getting around Manhatten. Lots of bars and Resturants within walking distance.
Would definately recommend
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I just came back from NY and had a great tiem with my husband and kids. Found Affinia 50 to be a comfortable place with a great location and extremely helpful staff. We not only felt welcomed but also knew the staff would take care of us. Our room was great. Except for a loose crew on the bathroom sink, everything else was perfect. We used the kitchen and took beautiful pics on the balacony. The children absolutely loved it. Oh...and again, it is such a good location. I would probably try to stay here again.
reviews.title: 'Welcome Home'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I spend a weekend at the Affinia 50 (me, my husband, and our eight year old son). It is a clean, beautifully decorated hotel in easy walking distance of many attractions. The beds and linens were especially nice. It has a nice lounge on the 2nd floor to rest in when you are tired of walking. The staff was wonderful; I don't think I have ever dealt with staff that were so polite. The hotel would be perfect if it were cheaper. Also, I don't recommend the breakfast buffet on the 2nd floor. It is okay, but not fantanstic, especially considering the price. You can get a better breakfast at the Ess-a-bagel place that is on the next block (and was recommended to me by the staff).
reviews.title: very nice!

reviews.text: I have to add to the collection of great reviews on this hotel. I just spent the weekend here and felt as though I was in an apartment not hotel room.
reviews.title: One more great review of affinia 50

likes.liked: — the friendly efficent service and room size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every person we encountered all weekend (guest and staff alike) was happy, smiles all around. pleasant hello's and great conversations.
reviews.title: Top Choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From check in to check out we experienced quick friendly service from the staff. The door man, the bellman and the reservationist. were some of the best we ever experienced.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic - That sums it up !

reviews.text: We had a two bedroom suite with two bathrooms and two balconies. We hosted a lunch for some family members and everyone was really impressed. The room was large,clean and comfortable. We used the room on the second floor for tea and coffee a few times and all the guests seemed very relaxed and happy. The atmosphere is exactly what most would want. Except for those who like glitz and glamour.
reviews.title: Absolutely awesome!

likes.disliked: — Not much! but lifts were a bit small and took time to arrive.

reviews.text: Just returned from nine nights at the Affinia 50 in New York City. My wife and two daughters (11 and 8) had a junior suite. We had selected the Affinia 50 based on the TripAdvisor ratings/reviews. If you are considering this hotel for your stay, book it now and do not look back. It was a wonderful experience. There were a few minor glitches (e.g. swipe card malfunction, one long elevator wait), but overall, we have no complaints. It was great having a refrigerator. And conveniently located - we walked or took the subway everywhere (the north/south 6 train stop is one block over on Lexington). Quite the enjoyable experience!
reviews.title: Book the Affinia 50 Now!

reviews.text: My husband , two boys and my sons girlfriend have just come back from New York on the 13th June, we stayed at the Affinia 50 for five nights. I must admit at first I found the room quite dingy and dark , but we had travelled a long way, it was raining very heavily and felt how had we come here on holiday. It was our first holiday in 10 years. We were very cold in the room the first night and was unable to get the heating working with the controls , told by the front desk that it was not working but they would send up a heater, worked fine and was warmer in no time, remember really tired so feeling a bit cheesed off. Had the best nights sleep I have ever had in a hotel, the mattress topper on the bed and of course my choice of pillow all added to the great comfort. I am not very good at staying in strange beds usually do not sleep well at all, but this bed was great. The second day a bit brighter all round, mood better, had a great nights sleep, so opinion changed, felt the room was fine, big and plenty of space for all our stuff. I must say the staff especially the doormen were absolutely delightful, very very helpful and so so pleasant all the time. Our room was kept reasonably clean, felt it could have been a bit better but fine. The location of the hotel is brilliant just short walk to 5th Avenue, Central Station, Saks, The NBA shop, Central Park, and Rockaffella Centre. Found our way about in no time, the shopping is fantastic, absolutely no money left now, but who cares!!! all well worth it. The only disappointment is that the hotel has no bar and a nightcap before bed and a chance to mingle with other hotel guests would have been good, but hey, has done our livers the world of good. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and a great big thank you to the wonderful doormen and hope you all have a great holiday like we did,
reviews.title: The Scots in New York

reviews.text: WELL BE BACK , AS ARNI SAYS!!!!
reviews.title: Bad Street Noise

reviews.text: The Affinia 50 was very disappointing after reading the stellar reviews found on this site over the last year. When I arrived, the staff could not find my reservation but after an hour finally were able to pull it up. The junior suite that I booked had the smallest bathroom and sink known in NYC hotels. I asked for a quiet room well in advance only to get one facing 3rd Avenue on the 8th floor as all I heard for 2 nights was street noise and car horns. The staff was not helpful at all during the check in process nor was I able to change rooms. Given the noise and the bathrooms, this hotel is not among the top 10 in New YorK City.
reviews.title: Would Stay Here again in a NY Minute!
Magnificent!
reviews.text: My mother and I just returned from a 4 day trip to NYC! I found Affinia 50 through TripAdvisor, whom I use for all my hotel references. TripAdvisor and it's users did not steer us wrong - Affinia 50 was perfect! Upon arrival around 2:15pm we were told that our room was not ready, the bellman stored our bags while we had a Thai lunch meal. Upon returning we were informed that we had been upgraded to a suite (we reserved a Jr. Suite). The suite was HUGE! I do believe that most Manhattanite's would kill for an apt this size! There were two queen beds, a sitting area, a bathroom (with nice tub and shower) and a kitchen. You could spend all day in the room and not feel cramped. We skipped the breakfast, but tried NY Deli (not impressive). Based on a review on this site, we tried Azure Deli (around the corner on 3rd, in the same building). We were blown away by this deli. The buffet was out of this world. Every food choice was available. The proprietor was soo cute.. I asked him if he was open 24 hours.. he said "25 hours.. one hour extra for you!" :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here at the beginning of October on our first trip to NYC. Had requested a room on a high floor when we booked which was 6 months before arrival, although no one bothered to answer my email. We were given a room on the 4th floor because all the "best" rooms were gone as we checked in late - 7pm. traffic noise was bad as expected but the bed was great - really comfortable. The furniture in the room was tatty & a bit threadbare but the housekeeping was good. Great location within walking distance of lots of sights & the subway. Doormen were lovely but some of the front desk staff were indifferent.
reviews.title: OK Stay

reviews.text: Our family of 5 stayed in two rooms at the Affinia 50 hotel for 5 nights in late Sept.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: Booked two Studio Suites which each had two Queen Beds and a small kitchenette. Ample room for the family.
reviews.title: Loved our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In hindsight, probably could have had one Studio and one Junior suite.
reviews.title: Great, central location

reviews.text: When we arrived after our long flights, we were told we could not have the room type we had booked and paid for due to some of the rooms requiring repairs and the fact the UN was sitting so they were very busy.
reviews.title: Great location, but rooms need to be cleaner and updated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Affinia the night of Feb 17, 2007, for a quick getaway. My heart sank when we walked into the room. It was was bare and small with a tiny window at least a foot above eye-level. Yes, there was a minibar, and a TV with a movie selection. The view I'd been looking forward to was of a chunk of a brick wall about 2 feet away from our "window." The minibar was empty, and none of the listed movies were available for viewing, for some mysterious reason. We called about the movies, to no avail. We had no control of the temperature in the room, and the "window" did not open. We called for a fan, and it was, in fact, delivered. It performed passably in creating a modicum of airflow in the stuffy atmosphere of the room.
reviews.title: Disappointing
Our own NYC apartment!
reviews.text: They did have Aveda shampoo and soap, however, so at least I got to take some good products home. And the location was convenient--I got a nice manicure at the excellent Bliss spa, very nearby.

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.text: FYI, our room was on the second floor--just make sure you ask about your view.

reviews.title: Great Location, Fair Rate
reviews.text: My two children and I recently stayed five nights at the Affinia 50, having booked a one bedroom suite on line. The high rating and positive reviews on tripadvisor were the reason I chose this property. Our rate varied from $289 Sunday to $379 Wed/Thurs. which I felt was great for the area and space.

The one bedroom suite was very large and accommodating; plenty of closet space and drawers. I was very pleased with the unkeep, furniture and linen. It's not luxurious, but not cheap and shabby either. The Aveda products were a plus. The kitchen was a bit old, but functional and clean. We had everything we needed and more!
reviews.title: Rude service and VERY Noisy Room, (the side facing the 50th st)

reviews.text: I just got back from a shopping trip to NYC. I originally found out about the Affinia 50 hotel from reading reviews on the TripAdvisor site. And I'm super happy that I did because I probably would not have known about this hotel otherwise. The service was great. The entire staff at the hotel was incredibly curteous. Mid-way through our trip, they recognized us by sight making us feel very welcome throughout our stay. The room was very well appointed. The beds were crisp, clean and very comfy. They even let you select from a menu of pillow options. The bathroom felt recently updated. We stayed in a unit that included a kitchen. Although, the kitchen was very dated, it was very convenient having a full sized fridge in the room for our water, soda, other beverages and restaurant leftovers. The cleaning staff was fantastic! The location is excellent. It's one block away from the Waldorf and just a few blocks from Madisson and 5 Avenue shopping! Right around the corner is an excellent bagel shop = Essa Bagel. The only downside is that the doors slam pretty loud. So every morning I woke up to a symphony of slamming doors as folks left their rooms. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great neighborhood hotel.
Great hotel for a family
reviews.text: Wow, what a huge room! We booked a "small suite" for our family of 5, and it was one of the most spacious rooms you can ever hope to find in New York. It was comfortable, very clean, quiet, and new-feeling. I expected the worst when booking a room in Manhattan, but this room was first-class in every way. The concierge service was also excellent. The clincher was that the hotel was easy walking distance to Times Square, the Theatre District, St. Patrick's Cathedral and Rockefeller Center. The room was more expensive than we usually pay, but it was well worth the price. I really have nothing but raves for this hotel!

We just returned from a 3 night visit at the Affinia 50. The location is fantastic - within walking distance to Central Park, Rockafeller Centre, Times Square and many other great spots. The one bedroom suite (there were 3 of us) is large - with a nice living room, dining room, kitchen, bathroom and very large living room.
reviews.title: Great Location and Large Rooms .... and a Few Cautions

likes.disliked: — Lack of wireless internet and surprise rate increase

reviews.text: A note of caution if you are booking directly through the hotel. You should book on line and print out the confirmation. When we arrived we were advised that there had been a rate change (and increase of about $60 per night). I was asked to show my confirmation print out to prove the rates I was quoted. Having my confirmation number solved the matter -- but we were astounded that they tried to just increase our rate at check in.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: The lounge on the 2nd floor is really nice. However, the coffee/tea maker was broken and the promised wireless computer access was for a sign up charge only. Most hotels include wireless for their guests these days, so we found the claims to wireless access a little misleading.
reviews.title: Great stay for a couple seeing the city

likes.disliked: — No place for a real breakfast

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here with my parents after reading reviews on trip advisor, and we were all impressed with the hotel. We arrived before official check in and so my room was not ready, however they were not expecting my parents for few days (it was booked though airmiles – we did not find out if it was the hotel’s fault). Luckily they could accommodate them and told us to come back at a certain time. Unfortunately when we came back the rooms were still not ready. In need of a rest we decided to wait in the lounge area, an hour later only one of the rooms was ready (contrary to more promises). When we finally did get the second room it had been upgraded to a suite and my parents were given a bottle of wine and a complementary breakfast. So they were very good about the problems, it is just a shame they had not given us a more accurate time for the rooms being ready we could have had an enjoyable afternoon sightseeing instead.

reviews.title: Just adding to the praise
reviews.text: That aside the rooms were of a high standard, very comfortable, clean and even a choice of pillows available.
Door staff were extremely helpful and always on hand when needed, they provided loads of maps and event info when they knew we were tourists.
reviews.title: great suite

reviews.text: Internet access in the lounge area with free printing available - very handy.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great price!

reviews.text: Only other negative point was the breakfast - they selection was limited, with very little warm food, once items were gone they were not replenished. It was also served in the lounge area so there were not proper tables to eat at. For my parents it was free so not too bad but for what they were charging, definitely not worth the money. There are no shortage of places to grab breakfast in the area so I would recommend giving it a miss if not included in your room rate.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed for two weeks in July 06. The staff where good and always friendly. Our room was a guestroom and it was not bad very clean. We had a terrible view of some airconditioning units out of the window but thought hey we are here to see NY not look out the window.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Affinia 50 is terrific
reviews.text: We would have been glad if we were offered a better room as we where staying for two weeks.
If you need any bookings or advise see Tanya on the 2nd floor she is fantastic and nothing is ever to much trouble for her.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel!

reviews.text: Go around the corner and have a bagel for breakfast or visit Azzure and buy some excellent food.
reviews.title: What a great place to stay.

reviews.text: The area the hotel is in is pretty boring but it is so central to all attractions.
reviews.title: spacious, clean, friendly with style

reviews.text: I booked this hotel with airmiles after reading the fabulous reviews. We had a studio with 2 queen beds and a kitchen for myself, my partner, my 5 year-old daughter and my teenage son. It is difficult to please all ages, but we all absolutely loved it. It is difficult to say anything which has not been said before - you will have read about the friendly doormen, the large rooms, the comfortable bed, the great location and the relaxed ambience. However, what sets this hotel apart from any other I have ever stayed in was the wine a cheese evening in the club room from 6-7, Monday to Thursday. Lots of wine, lots of cheese and biscuits, and even bingo on a Thursday evening with excellent prizes. A lovely opportunity to meet fellow travellers and share stories of this great city, before walking a block or two for world class cuisine in any number of nearby restaurants. We had a wonderful stay in NYC, and if I'm ever lucky enough to return, I will check out the Affinia Fifty - hopefully it will not be priced out of my range once the world catches on to the great value currently on offer. I cannot rate this hotel highly enough.
reviews.title: Don't miss the wine and cheese!

likes.disliked: — The lifts were sometimes a little slow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just checked out of the Affinity about 12 hrs ago and now back in UK. it was a great hotel. They gave us a room on arrival at noon eventhough they had been mad busy , the room that was ready was an upgrade so we were really pleased with the service. Such a big room for NYC, small kitchen etc. I really can't fault the service, room , linens , cleanliness or location.
reviews.title: What a great location!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, Sam the bellboy, space in the room, small kitchen.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were 5 mins walk from Grant Central Station, 10 mins from Rockerfeller centre, 20 mins from Central Park and 10 mins from Bloomingdales.
reviews.title: I will stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: between 6pm and 7pm on Floor 2 they have complimentary cheese and wine but we missed it every day we stayed as we were out and about in the city. Maybe next time !
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.text: I totally loved this hotel, I can believe how cheap it was, about 150 dollars a night for a standard room.
reviews.title: Huge space for Manhattan

likes.disliked: — Expensive internet access, but typical for NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Affinia 50 on Dec 30 + 31, 2006. First time in New York. Great location, nice clean rooms, extremely friendly staff. Room size was pretty big considering what I had read about small rooms in NY. Would definately stay there again. Thanks to all for the helpful reviews, it is because of this site we booked there. Only complaint would be the shower didn't drain fast enough so you stand in ankle deep water, but I understand this is quite common in these re-done hotels.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Highly Recommend

reviews.text: We had a one night stay at the Affinia 50 on Christmas night. Arrived late, but were welcomed with open arms and no wait. We had a one bedroom suite booked, and had requested queen beds. Suite was exactly as requested; queens and the sofabed made up. The suite was quiet, extremely comfortable - so much so we didn't want to leave the beds in the morning! Valet worked great for the car. We checked out and they were happy to hold our bags while we visited the city. Called about 30 minutes before returning and the car and bags were waiting for us. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. Great for families - we were traveling with two teenagers and it was great. Great location - even a Starbucks on the corner. Would not stay anywhere else in Manhattan.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful stay at the Affinia 50!

likes.liked: — Extremely comfortable beds, plenty of room in suite

reviews.text: We stayed at the Affinia 50 for one night - Dec 22 to 23rd - the very busy, last weekend before Christmas. Our stay here was a pleasant surprise. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. It is particularly nice for business travelers or families who want larger, suite-type accommodations.
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We learned about the hotel through a "low rates" type travel e-mail, and booked a King bed + sofabed room for a very good rate. Upon arriving, the reception staff discovered we had children with us and immediately upgraded us to a HUGE corner suite. We didn't even ask! No extra charge! The suite was amazing - clean and HUGE. Separate kitchen area with a stove, fridge/freezer, microwave, dishwasher, dishes, etc. Enormous living room area with the pull-out sofa already made up for our kids and 19th floor City views along two walls. Eating area with a dining table that sat four. Plenty of closet and drawer space - even a small walk-in closet. Our kids thought they were movie stars, the place was that nice. Our bedroom was equally spacious and well appointed. Large screen TVs in both rooms and high end grooming products in the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms were quiet. The Website description and photos really didn't do the place justice. Every staff member that we encountered was very polite and nice, and even apologized for getting on to the elevator with us. We did not have to wait to check in, check out, check our baggage, or get an elevator. And as I mentioned previously, this was peak Christmas season in NYC - we anticipated large crowds, long waits and plenty of rude NY citizens and staff. We encountered none of these. If I need to find any flaws with this establishment (and I really have to think hard...) I would say that there was a little bit of water damage in the bathroom, but nothing that affected the cleanliness of it - there was no mildew or antiquated bathtub caulk - and the bathroom was on the smaller size. But in NYC, I expect things to be a little on the efficient, space-saving side. The other thing I noted was that the cabinets in the kitchen were on the low-budget side, but I was so tickled to even have a kitchen in my suite, I really didn't care! I did not take note of the decor; everything seemed tastefully done to me and the furniture was of nice quality; nothing stood out as old or tacky.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in Midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is IDEAL. It is a couple of blocks from Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's, Radio City, the great shopping on Fifth Avenue, etc. We had 9AM tickets for the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City, and all we had to do was walk out the front door, turn right, walk 4 blocks and enter Radio City. The location made it easy for us to walk to the Sony Wonder Technology Lab & Museum and the Museum of Modern Art (both wonderful attractions and free on Friday nights!) There are great restaurants at all price levels and cuisine types a block away from the hotel, and even a McDonald's around the corner. If you drive into the City, the hotel offers valet parking at competitive rates, or there are lots on 50th or 51st streets. There is a subway station very close by, so you really don't need a car to get around.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: We just came back from New York City where we spent 3 nights at the Affinia 50. The rooms are quite spacious for New York and for the price. We had a king size bed, a fridge, and a coffee maker. The bathroom is a decent size, except it had only a vent and not a fan. Minor detail. The staff, the service, and the location are all wonderful. Many places to eat in the area, and close to all the major attractions. A great place for breakfast is the Morning Star Cafe, on 2nd Avenue and 50th Street. Would go back to this hotel next time in New York.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this after consulting reviews and was not disappointed.
reviews.title: No Nonesense Central Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel is superbly located a few blocks from many of the major attractions.
reviews.title: Comfort and Convenience

reviews.text: Booked standard double which was spacious with huge bed, writing desk, easy chair, table, fridge, coffee machine & widescreen t.v. with inroom entertainment system.
reviews.title: Just what you need for a great, up-to-date midtown hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom was also spacious with part sunk tub & power shower, complimentary "Avida" toiletries.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Rooms are large, clean and comfortable. Staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I picked the Affinia chain because of the amazing reviews on TripAdvisor and was not at all disappointed. We ( 2 adults, 2 kids, 12 and 15) stayed in a Junior Suite, with 2 queen beds. Tons of room, and not just by New York standards. Beautifully finished, great beds, comforters and terrific bathroom and toiletries. Room to set up your computer on a rather large desk and a very useful, but very small kitchen, with a stove, fridge, sink, dishware, pots, toaster, microwave all supplied. Only issue is that if you are plannin on eating in a Junior Suite, there is not really anywhere to sit around a table. There is a chair and ottoman and then the beds. Great TV, tons of storage. Great and helpful staff. We were a bit worried about the location at 50th and 3rd, but no concerns. Walked to the theatres in about 20 minutes. Also very close to at least 2 subway stops. We got a great deal by taking a non-refundable rate from the hotel's website itself and saved a bunch of money. In short....stay here...you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!!!!

reviews.text: Three of us stayed at the hotel over Christmas for 5 nights in a one-bedroom apartment. The hotel is very well situated on E50th and Third in Midtown. The apartment was clean, spacious and very comfortable. As we had a kitchen we ate breakfast in the apartment so are unable to comment on the breakfasts on the Club floor. There is a supermarket a block away and the area is well served with diners and restaurants. The concierge service was excellent and the reception staff and doormen friendly and helpful. We would certainly use the hotel next time we are in New York.
reviews.title: Very well located

reviews.text: stayed there this past weekend. (12-01-06) even though it was extremely busy due to Christmas, all employees were very friendly, polite, and courteous. nice lobby, rest area on the 2nd floor was comfortable, good location, they had all to offer. the room was very clean, nothing wrong, good tv,fridge,clean bathroom. we will be staying there again.
reviews.title: very nice, no disappointment.

reviews.text: First time to NYC from Australia. Found the hotel through Tripadvisor website. Beyond our expectations! Two huge luxurious beds for the four of us, AND a loungroom and kitchen! Two TV's which made the kids (and us) happy ( they could watch telly in the other room)
reviews.title: Beyond expectations!

likes.liked: — The size of the room. The staff. Safes in the rooms
likes.disliked: — The shower taps- difficult to regulate temperature of water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a huge corner room, and one extra bonus which people should know is that it had a safe in the room for locking up valuables. Sid at the front desk was fantastic! Great restaurants close by.
reviews.title: Affinia wonderful

reviews.text: We all loved this place and we are already planning our return trip to NYC to stay at the Affinia 50!
reviews.title: Huge rooms; good stay; great with kids

reviews.text: We have just returned from The Affinia and it exceeded expectations. We stayed in a Queen room on the 5th floor, we didn't have a street view but as we were in New York to sight see this didn't bother us. The room was clean, the bed was soooo comfortable the bed linen was lovely and crisp, we didn't bother with the pillow menu as the ones we had were comfy enough. The bathroom was small but spotless. It was wonderful to have a fridge to keep drinks cool and also a coffee maker, (not often found in New York hotel rooms).
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great location

reviews.text: The Affinia 50 is in a great location. Staff professional and informative but I wouldn't say overly friendly. Bed and pillows very comfortable although room showed signs of wear around the edges. Location of room near ice/vending machines made it a bit noisy; in addition just above what I think was the HVAC unit so that made it a bit noisy. I would stay there again for the location.
reviews.title: Affinia 50 great location, room so-so

likes.liked: — location in midtown near times square, theatre district
likes.disliked: — location of room and noise level of that room

reviews.text: I travelled with two teenage children and found the hotel to be exactly what I had hoped for. It had huge rooms and a lovely bathroom. As we were taking an evening flight transatlantic, the hotel offered the opportunity to use the leisure centre shower facilities to shower and change after checkout and before the flight. I was very grateful for this as we spent the day out and about and it was hot and sunny.
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.disliked: — Noise from roadworks but only for one night

reviews.title: Favorite hotel in NYC
reviews.text: I would stay here again without hesitation if I travel to New York again.

reviews.title: Great for families
reviews.text: This hotel is my favorite place to stay in NYC and it is mostly because of the staff. I stay here often for business and for the past 3 years, the staff has been consistent. They always address me by name and are extremely accomodating. It is also a perfect location. I highly recommend.
The hotel was perfect for our family of 4 (two girls aged 13 and 11).
reviews.title: Great hotel for touring NYC

likes.disliked: — lobby had a strange smell, but rooms were fine

reviews.text: This is advertised as an executive suite hotel and as such is oversold. The website is a perfect example of how carefully chosen photographs and sufficient hype can oversell a hotel. The rooms were adequate in size but the bathroom was tiny. The clothes closets were open with no doors as was the kitchen. The kitchen had chipped worktops, a grubby fridge and units that looked as though they were meant for a garage rather than an executive suite hotel.
reviews.title: An adequate hotel

reviews.text: The room had seen better days and not only needed redecorating but was also not very clean. There were marks on the walls and stains on the carpet made you feel uncomfortable about walking across the room in bare feet.
reviews.title: Better Than Expected

reviews.text: The location was good and the front door staff were excellent. However, if you are looking for an executive suite hotel in New York I suggest you look further than this barely adequate hotel.
reviews.title: Don't expect much from the staff
Great stay in NYC
reviews.text: Thanks, TripAdvisor! I studied reviews of many hotels in New York, choosing the Affinia Colletion because it offered suites. Our family of 8 adults, which included an 84 year-old aunt & 90 year-old mother, needed room for two wheelchairs, & lots of luggage. We chose a 1 bedroom & 2 bedroom suite. Fabulous 2 bedroom suite on the 17th floor - more floor space than imagined, with big bedrooms, great kitchen & lounging area, all clean & tastefully decorated. In the midst of the heat wave, we could not wait to get back to our room for the comfort. Great staff - always cheerful & helpful, particularly in procuring cabs. Responded quickly to requests for extra anything. Pleasant to have the kitchen facilities, as we ate our breakfasts & several dinners in our suite. Not difficult to walk to Times Square, UN, Grand Central Terminal, Empire State Bldg, St. Patrick's Cathedral, & Central Park (south entrance). Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Affinia 50 advertises as a business hotel, but it served our family superbly. We will use this hotel again.

The rooms were nice and comfortable, but the staff is not close to acceptable, I had a package delivered before I checked out, and even though I asked more than once at the front desk wether they had it or not, they always said nothing had arrived, now I have to have it picked up by an acquaintance in NYC. Also, the concierge was unavailable most of the time.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Location Eh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Affinia 50 for two nights over the Martin Luther King holiday weekend. Promotional rates were in effect and so it was a good value averaging $169 per night including all taxes.
reviews.title: Fairly high marks all around

reviews.text: Standard room was a good size and had a great king size bed. Very comfortable. Bathrooms were nice but small. HD television did not have HD service. There was free WiFi on the club floor but expensive in the rooms. PC's available on the club floor were not free and expensive for 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Apartment very good

reviews.text: Breakfast was not available on the weekend, but there is a little diner right next door which was fine. Coffee was available, but they ran out of milk and cream and nobody was around to refill.
reviews.title: Great Value, Good Location - But Not Posh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly.
reviews.title: Find another hotel!

reviews.text: We are a family of 5 & have stayed here previously in 2 sep rooms. This time we took a 1br apt. This hotel is not 5 star Australan standard, but very comfy,affordable for a family and in a great location.
reviews.title: Average
Loved the Affinia 50
reviews.text: We just got home from an amazing weekend in the city. The Affinia 50 was a great place to stay. It was a girls weekend away for us and we felt very comfortable in this part of town. We stayed on the 16th floor in a one bedroom suite. I have stayed in quite a few hotels and I have to say that this suite was VERY LARGE. The kitchen with full size fridge was a plus for all of our snacks and drinks.
The doormen were so sweet and were GREAT at getting cabs very quickly for us.
reviews.title: Absolutely Awesome Affinia 50

reviews.text: I do suggest the New York Lunchonette two doors down as well as Wollensky's Grill a block away. It was an amazing steak house with fabulous service and a fun atmosphere.
reviews.title: Location, Size and Family Friendly
Feel Safe and Single
reviews.text: Back to the hotel...we have absolutly no complaints! Just a forwarning, some of the stores security devices will deactivate your room key cards so be prepared to make a few trips back down to the lobby bc you can't get in your room. It wasn't really a hassle and they always gave us new cards very quickly!
Also, there is a little grocery shop with toiletries, drinks, snacks, etc. just a few doors down. It was nice to have something so close to grab things that we might have forgotten.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading tripadvisor ratings of the Affinia 50, we booked for a three night stay the week of Valentine's Day, Feb. 13-16. We were very pleased by every aspect of our stay, and found it a great "home base" for exploring the city. The Affinia 50 is conveniently located to lots of Midtown attractions, restaurants, and the subway. We were able to walk to the Rockefeller Center, the theater district, Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Grand Central Station, and more. The room was very attractive, very clean and more spacious than we expected. The best feature of the room was the bed, which was perhaps the most comfortable of any hotel bed we have ever experienced. The staff of the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The Affinia 50 was perfect for our winter get-away, and it is a place that we would most definitely stay again. Absolutely no complaints or concerns, only compliments for the Affinia 50!
reviews.title: Great Home Base for Exploring the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay at the Affinia 50. The staff are always welcoming. We were fortunate enough to obtain a suite, with kitchen facilities, lounge and dining room. The room was always clean. Our room was located towards the back of the hotel, nice and quite. Excellent deli around the corner. Central location. Great value and spacious.
reviews.title: Felt like home

likes.disliked: — Lack of view in rear rooms.

reviews.text: During last summer’s heat wave, my wife and I, in the midst of a long walk around Manhattan’s Upper East Side, sought momentary shelter from the elements in the serenely cool and relaxed lobby of the Affinia Gardens on 64th Street. Though we weren’t registered guests, kind treatment by the staff inspired a positive perception of the Affinia brand on our part. So for a quick weekend family getaway in mid winter, we selected the Affinia 50 in Midtown. Our stay reinforced that positive initial perception and propelled the Affinia name to the top of our list.
reviews.title: Space, Comfort and the Right Price

likes.liked: — The excellent room layout and abundant floor space.

reviews.text: There’s not much more to say about the Affinia 50’s fantastic location beyond what’s already been written by other reviewers. This part of Midtown offers everything a visitor to Manhattan could possibly desire. Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall are a few short blocks, as are any number of excellent restaurants, retail shops, museums and other attractions. The Lexington Avenue subway line is literally steps away, providing unlimited access to points throughout the city. The neighborhood has all the excitement and vibe one seeks in Midtown and yet is just a bit more relaxed than areas just to the west or a few blocks to the south.
reviews.title: Worthwhile if they hold the prices

reviews.text: Beyond location, this property’s greatest asset may be the surprising amount of floor space offered in its guest rooms. Our Junior Suite featured two queen sized beds and a large pullout sofa. With a fully appointed walk-in kitchen and a good sized bathroom, even with the pullout extended, the unit had the space and feel of a comfortable Manhattan studio apartment. This is a lodging rarity in Manhattan’s more attractive neighborhoods unless one is prepared to shell out ridiculous money.
reviews.title: Big comfortable bed

reviews.text: We stayed at the Affinia 50 the last week of December including New Years Eve. Two adults, two children in a one bedroom suite.
reviews.title: More Space Less Service

likes.liked: — the size of the room and the comfy beds

reviews.text: Pros: really large room, two queens in the bedroom and a pull out in the living room, great comfy beds, prompt maid service and good location.
reviews.title: NYC Home

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and the location
likes.disliked: — had to ask for shampoo and coffee

reviews.text: Cons: all the common areas are really small (really small) with low celings and everything needs a good scrub, thankfully we were on the 6th floor because we took the stairs (even at checkout w- 4 suitcases) most of our stay, the 2 elevators are very slow, the front desk seems overwhelemed and put out, could not make change for larger bills or arrange for cars, we only saw the door man once during our stay (but was very helpful that one time) and don't even try the coin op laundry, it's just plain scary.
reviews.title: Mixed but overall good value

likes.liked: — large rooms, pillow menu, value for the money

reviews.text: I will mention we did not get a deal, we paid $398.00 a night, not again.
reviews.title: This is how hotels should be.

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in midtown Manhattan just after New Years during the recent heat wave. Hotel was clean and price was decent for this quality hotel in NYC. Since we stayed more than 3 nights we got an additional 20% off through Expedia. Room was 2 large beds with a small Kitchenette. One day when we returned the doorman said welcome home. Our room on the seventh floor had some minor things such as a bedlight missing from one of the beds (had obviously been ripped out) and the temperature controls didn't seem to have much effect. The staff was very helpful when asked about directions or any of our needs. My only real complaint was that the shampoo and conditioners were not replenished the first night and neither was the coffee. Both of these items were quickly remedied when I brought it to their attention. The room was a little loud from street noise. Their is a club of some type right nest door that must be popular since draws crowds late at night. Beds were very comfortable and all in all would stay here again. Location is excellent with Subway nearby and within easy walking distance of 5th avenue stores and Rockefeller Center.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

likes.liked: — Use the Quick Check feature on this page to find the best rates. Hotel website offered best price of $219, but Travelocity was $136 for the same room. If fewer than three in your group, from JFK or LaGuardia Airport, take the NY Airport Service Bus to Grand Central Station and transfer to its hotel shuttle; MetroCards are $7 for 24 hour unlimited subway and bus or $24 for a 7-day pass (as opposed to $2 a trip).

reviews.title: Girls weekend- great find
reviews.text: Most average hotel rooms were booked Oct. 16th weekend. My father had stayed here on buisness and thought it would be great! We had a nurses reunion with 4 friends reuniting and the suites could not be better!! Plenty of room (larger than many NYC apts! 650 sq. ft.) We had happy hour in the living room, coffee in the kitchen am, plenty of room for 4 women to stay. Great location, midtown and Park /Madison ave. shopping, a brisk walk to times square, second ave. Irish pubs or if you prefer Whiskey Blue "W" lounge a stone throw away! Note- we live in the burbs of NYC and come in often. This place is a find!!! Shhhh, don't tell everyone about our secret place or we may not get a reservation when we need one!

reviews.title: a fabulous weekend
reviews.text: Our weekend stay at the Affinia was absolutely fabulous. The staff was both professional and friendly, the accomodations were perfect, and the location was the best.

reviews.title: Affinia50 is a great place to stay in NYC
reviews.text: Every person who worked there was so helpful and made us feel very comfortable. They suggested places to visit and eat and the best way to get around.

reviews.title: Very Very Good Hotel
reviews.text: The room was clean, spacious and nicely decorated. Even the bed linens and pillows were cozy.

reviews.title: Great people and place
reviews.text: Everyone made us feel special and we would definitely stay there again.
The Affinia 50 was a great stay. The staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms well decorated and spacious, the location a stones throw from lots of attractions and shopping.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: The extra nice touches were the small kitchens in each room, great for making coffee or snacks and the executive lounge on the 2nd floor where you can sprawl out on comfy sofas wtch the large screen plasma TV or check your E Mail (cost extra)
reviews.title: Spacious, comfortable, perfect location!
Recommend the Affinia 50
reviews.text: If you are catering for yourself there is a great deli on third ave just one block from the hotel (turn left on third) or a large grocery store (associated) one block over of 48th and 2nd.

reviews.title: great stay ,excellent room , ideal location
reviews.text: My only critisism is the cost, however compared to the cost of comparable hotels in the area it is very good value for money.
I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Affinia is the Best Affordable Hotel in NYC

reviews.text: This was our third visit to this Affinia property. Our rate for a Junior Suite was $279/night, which was good at the time. I have reserved this property for less during February and with more advance notice other times of the year. The suite was plenty big for two of us. Make sure to buy water and snacks outside of the hotel, as the prices were very steep for the honor bar - $7 for a bottle of water. The 2nd floor club lounge is nice, with free coffee, tea, wifi, televison and Wii in the back room. This was a valuable place to catch up on business, as internet in the room was at least $15/day. We did not have breakfast at the hotel; they offer a continental room service for $9pp or $15 buffet in the lounge. Instead, we opted to visit Morning Star Cafe on 2nd btw 50th and 51st. I may return to this hotel again, but am thinking of the Affinia Manhattan or Shelbourne next time to compare.
reviews.title: Third visit. Can't beat the price, location and size of rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the TA reviews. The location is fantastic and it's a great choice if you're looking for convenience and a nice, comfy room but OK to give up the five star lobby amenities (restaurant/bar, huge lobby, etc).
reviews.title: Good find for midtown, with a few glitches

reviews.text: Our room was a pleasant surprise. We were expecting a shoebox but it was a good size. The bathroom was tiny but everything needed was there, including a bathtub (we were expecting a tiny shower) and Philosophy toiletries (a nice plus). The bed was extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: A+++ Affinia 50

reviews.text: The downside was that our thermostat control wasn't working and the room was very warm (~80F). We asked the front desk to take a look and they did - but weren't able to fix it, so they just left the window open. That solution worked OK but not great (lots of noise from the street outside) and there was no apology or follow up. That was a disappointment.
reviews.title: Great location, reasonable hotel

reviews.text: The other glitch is that there can be a long wait for the elevators but if you book a room on the 5th floor or below (our was on the 4th), there's a third elevator option - which worked great for us.
reviews.title: Affinia 50. I hope to return.

reviews.text: "Welcome Home" is very fitting and how you will be greeted upon arrival at this excellent hotel. I stayed in Affinia 50, 155 East 50th St with my friend for 5 nights from 14/9/08 and it was indeed like coming home. The concierge staff were extremely helpful and in particular, Rome and Manny to whom nothing was a problem. Rome was very attentive and made sure to greet us by name each day, which gave us that feeling of being welcomed home!
reviews.title: Welcome Home

reviews.text: As expected, based on Trip Advisor reviews, the hotel did not disappoint. The rooms are spacious and clean with very comfy beds. The bathroom is quite small but that is a minor detail. Having the kitchen was a bonus as we could prepare our light breakfast each day, (tea & toast) but should you have wanted to, the facilities were good enough to prepare a full meal! No need to do that however as there are many excellent restaurants and delis on the doorstep. Highly recommended are PAX for lunch to either eat in or take out and for evening meal Mama Mexico, both of which are very close by. Be sure however to take advantage of the wine and cheese available in the hotel each evening between 6-7pm on level 2. Lifts did not always stop for us, instead they whizzed by on occasion, we were on 6th floor, but it was not a huge problem.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

likes.liked: — The big room and comfy bed
likes.disliked: — elevators which bypassed our floor constantly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's location is excellent, being close to Grand Central, The Rock and 5th Avenue. It's also easy to walk to Central Park, which offers a pleasant change from all the buzz of the city. This hotel certainly lives up to it's expectations and is highly recommended, I certainly look forward to a "welcome home" in the not too distant future!
reviews.title: Affinia 50 - Absolutely Faultless!

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in September and thought it was really excellent. We had a really big room which had 2 comfy double beds and plenty of space to move around in. Everything was clean and the decor was good. The kitchen was a bonus and we were able to make our breakfast: tea and toast every morning. The fridge was big, plenty of room in it for supplies and there was even a full size cooker. However, a small table with chairs would have been good in the room but as we only had breakfast here it wasn't a problem. The location was ideal for the subway and also for the downtown hop on/off bus (at the Waldorf) which we used for 2 days a great way to see around the city. There were some grocery shops nearby as well as cafes and a choice of restaurant.s. The hotel is within walking distance of Central Park, 5th Avenue and the 'Rock' and it felt safe to walk around the area at night. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful and Rome and Manny get a special mention, two great guys. It is good when staff actually remember your name and acknowledge you as Rome did. We had a problem with our safe late one night and it was fixed very quickly for us. This is the only place we would stay in New York now.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having decided to travel to New York to get married, my husband and I wanted a really nice hotel that wouldn't cost the earth. There were so many hotels to chose from that we decided to go with the Affinia 50 based on the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Good Quality Hotel

reviews.text: We arrived well before check-in time and our room was ready! Fantastic and warm service from all staff. Excellent location, comfortable beds, spacious room, delicious buffet that is reasonably priced. All of this makes this a primo New York hotel for the money. We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Allround excellence!

reviews.text: We (three people; three generations) stayed at the Affinia 50 for four nights in early October—my first time at this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location; doesn't feel like a big, impersonal hotel

likes.liked: — Location, comfortable bed, full kitchen in a hotel room

reviews.text: I’ve stayed in plenty of different places in New York City-—from the floor of a friend’s apartment in Brooklyn Heights to the Peninsula. My location of choice is generally Midtown east, which I find to be easy walking distance to many things, but just far enough away from the crowds around Broadway and Times Square.
reviews.title: just as good as expected!

likes.disliked: — small room with bad view & could hear noise

reviews.text: About four months in advance, I booked a studio suite for an average price of $330 per night. I continued to watch prices after I booked, but never found anything that I considered to be a better deal for this holiday weekend.
reviews.title: Loved the Affinia 50

likes.liked: — friendliness of doormen and requested pillows

reviews.text: The Affinia 50 is at the corner of 50th and 3rd Avenue. There are three other hotels in the same block, along with a couple of restaurants and clubs. The Waldorf Astoria is a block away. It is about four blocks to 5th Avenue (Saks and St. Patrick’s), six blocks to Grand Central, and a couple of blocks to the nearest subway station at 53rd and 3rd.
reviews.title: Loved the Price and Accommodations at the Affinia 50

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in May of this year and was delighted with my choice.
reviews.title: " for a Big room in the Big Apple the Affina 50 can't be beaten!"

reviews.text: Superb location, friendly helpful staff and very spacious rooms. Great value for money, will definately return. A real New York gem! The azzure deli round the corner on 3rd Avenue is not to be missed!
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

reviews.text: We just returned from a 7-night stay at the Affinia 50. I felt somewhat comfortable in choosing the Affinia 50 based on the reviews on Tripadvisor, but I was VERY relieved when I saw the room. On the desk was a note and a complimentary bottle of red wine, even though I don't drink, it was a nice gesture. I was worried that the bathroom would be small, but it was actually a nice size. The hotel was centrally located. We were not far from anything. The one thing that did pose a problem was trying to catch a cab close to 7 or 8 o'clock. Prior to arriving at La Guardia Airport, I called the hotel to see about getting car service from the airport to the hotel. The hotel uses a company called Spectacular Limo Service. I explained that there would be 3 ladies, who would have about 3 suitcases per person. The bellhop assured me that the town car would be large enough to accommodate our luggage and us. We were disappointed when we were cramped in the town car and learned that we could have gotten a larger vehicle for a better price from the Dial 7 Company. We did the party shuttle tour, but I wouldn't recommend it. It was hard to really see the buildings the tour guide was showing us; therefore, I would recommend the double-decker bus tour. We asked for extra towels, and they were happy to accommodate; however, the shower tile could have used some mildew cleaner. Overall, my first trip to New York was made even more memorable by the friendly staff and wonderful accommodations at the Affinia 50.
reviews.title: Definitely a Repeat!

reviews.text: As a business traveler, I visit New York at least a dozen times a year. I have stayed at the Affinia 50 at least five or six times this year. Obviously, I would recommend staying here, as I have returned again and again. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Their trademark "Cheers" is a bit cheesy, but kind of cute.
reviews.title: Is it really that good??

reviews.text: We just returned from our NYC trip and stayed at the Affinia. After having stayed at many New York hotels over the years I have to say that the Affinia is one of the best overall values that I've expereinced. We had a full suite - more like an apartment - not one of those tiny so-called suites you find in some hotels, and it was very quiet given it was away from the street. The staff are all a friendly bunch, all helpful, especially Rome at the front door. Ask him if he's from Rome and you'll get a very funny answer. The overall service is a cut above other hotels (and many that cost a lot more money). We asked for two small repairs and they were done within minutes. We asked for a few supplies and they brought them (and more) right away. Every restaraunt choice they suggested was better than average. On top of the large accomodations, nice furnishings and quiet room, the suite's price was equivalent to a room in many less-stellar hotels around town. I rarely leave Manhattan saying I loved that hotel and will stay there again. Well, on my next trip to the Big Apple I know where I'm staying - the Affinia. There's only one small neagative I saw the whole week at this place. The room service isn't in house, but comes from a restaraunt across the steet. It's an Indian place called The Mint. The food we ordered came fast but it was on the equivalent of a bad diner - and a bad diner with very high prices. We didn't order Indian food (maybe that would have been better) but they had a selection of Continental dishes. Speaking of diners, there's a great one (can't rember the name) about a hundred-yards east of the hotel on the same side of the street. Bottom Line: great location (next to several hotels, and conveineinet to Second Ave with more eateries than you could ever make it to), great, spacious accomodations at good prices and nice people working there. That's all refreshing in a city where getting even one of those things is usually considered lucky.... unless you're willing to pay $1,000 a night.
reviews.title: Fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great wee hotel, with professional, friendly, curteous and above all - helpful staff. They had answers for all of our questions, eg where to eat, transport arrangements, map info, must see places, must do things etc etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel itself has a small but cosy lobby with fast lifts to the upper floors. I willnee go on about the hotel because we just used it to sleep. But it was quiet, the rooms were big and comfy and the tea/coffee facilities were excellent. Oh and the bathrooms were clean and the shower worked well.
reviews.title: 2 Thumbs Up!

likes.disliked: — Paying for internet but I think this is typical at hotels now.

reviews.text: What more could you ask for?
reviews.title: Warm welcome from the Affinia 50

likes.liked: — Warm welcome, spacious and clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PS Two great cafes for your traditional American Breakfast's'ss's just one block left the other a few yards right, as you come out of the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: Nice room, though it was starting to show its age. 2 out of 3 evenings had no heat until after 10:00PM. Smoke alarm battery had to be replaced to stop annoying beep. Staff was pleasant and generally responsive. Excellent location for dining.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Hotel If Heating Issues Resolved

reviews.text: I have stayed here before and been happy, but something has changed.
reviews.title: It shouldn't be this hard...

reviews.text: I was given a totally inappropriate room, and there was simply nothing they would do to fix it. In spite of the fact that I had another reservation again three days later, loyalty meant nothing. Two adults and two children were crammed into a very small "deluxe 1 bedroom". Believe me, there was NOTHING deluxe about this room. The "kitchen" was barely big enough for one person to turn around in. The rug was stained, the room smelled bad, and was so small that the table for four that was shoved into the corner could only fit three chairs. Management said that we had booked the room incorrectly,. I still can't figure out how booking a 1 bedroom deluxe room at $500.00 a night + tax gets us a room that barely fits two people, when they have multiple rooms of this type available. I know. I have stayed in them. To add insult to injury, they kept telling us that they had no other rooms available, and as I was standing outside my room, another couple was brought to their rom, which was clearly significantly bigger than the one we were in. So they HAD rooms available, but refused to move things around even when it was clear that something was wrong.
reviews.title: Nice place, good value

reviews.text: We had ordered several extras, and had to make multiple calls to get them, in spite of the promise that they would be there upon our arrival.
reviews.title: Affinia 50

reviews.text: The first morning, we left at 9am, and when we came back at 4:00pm our room had still not been made up. Housekeeping came and seemed very put out by our request to make up the room (We had two small children that needed a nap after being out since 9AM) They said that if we had wanted "early cleaning" we should have requested it.
reviews.title: Lovely, clean, mid-town boutique hotel
Wouldn't change a thing
reviews.text: This hotel has their act together. Very professional, friendly, approachable staff. Wonderful, clean comfortable and LARGE rooms. Very quiet and safe. No frills lobby but who cares about that? Good breakfast a few steps from the hotel (turn right as you exit the lobby) and a little market and McDonalds just around the corner (turn left as you exit). This hotel puts all of the emphasis on the rooms and staff and has very competative rates for NYC. The location is not perfect for subway travel but still very good. Stay here!

My family and I spent four nights in the Affinia 50 in April. Overall we enjoyed our stay. The hotel was clean and sleek, with very comfortable bedding. The doormen and house keeping were excellent. The front desk and the conceirge desk seemed to be slightly overwhelmed at times. Street noise was only noticable on a few occasions.
reviews.title: Nice stay at the Affinia 50

reviews.text: We spent the first two nights in a Junior Suite. The room was very spacious with a king and a queen sleeper sofa. The bathroom was spacious and there was plenty of room for storage. The kids didn't complain too much about sleeping on the fold out. The kitchenette was a nice feature. It's alway nice to have fridge stocked with drinks. We stayed in this room over the weekend due to availability. It was a bit pricey.
reviews.title: Surprising value -- new favorite

reviews.text: The second half of our trip we stayed in a room a 2-queen room. This was a bit smaller, with a tight bathroom. However, both beds were very comfortable and everyone slept very well. There was a kitchenette in this room as well. The weekday prices on this room were quite reasonable.
reviews.title: Loved Affinia 50!!

reviews.text: We never tried the food the breakfast at the hotel.
reviews.title: Three S's - Smart, spacious and service

reviews.text: Great location and accessible from all great nyc sights. Got a good deal on priceline while staying here for work. Got in really late and decided to order room service after midnight. A grilled cheese was $22 so I would not recommend doing this. However, clean comfortable and friendly.
reviews.title: trendy hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here twice. The front desk staff and the bellmen are very friendly and helpful and on top of things. The hotel is an an excellent location in Midtown. We booked 5 months in advance but arrived to find out the "standard" rooms are on floors 2 to 5; the 3rd floor room was too small and right on the avenue where you could hear all the traffic noise. The rooms on higher floors are called "suites" but they are just larger rooms with a small kitchenette. We paid more and moved to floor 17, and room was large, clean, and quiet (for NYC). The bed was comfortable, the shower worked fine. The carpet was a bit dated. We did not use the kitchen but fridge was nice to have. I wish it had had a full size ironing board, the tiny one was impossible to iron a shirt on. I recommend the rooms on the higher floors. The "club room" on the 2nd floor has a nice seating area and a business center, but has limited hours. I woke up at 5am and needed to leave the room so that my boyfriend could sleep, but the club room did not open Sunday till 8am so I was stuck with no place to go, as there is no seating area in the entrance lobby, and the business center is inside the locked club room. The club room and business center should really be available 24 hours with a key, like the fitness center. Overall, a decent hotel with helpful staff in a great location (but insomniacs beware!)
reviews.title: Great location, friendly service

reviews.text: Dec. 17-21. This was our families first trip to New York City and we had high hopes for the Affinia 50. For starters check in time is suppose to be at 3:00pm. We arrived at 6:00pm only to be kept waiting by the incompitent staff saying our room was not ready yet. Thirty confusing minutes of waiting in the lobby were followed by our gracious host telling us we were being switched to a different room. The room we were given (1102) has a lovely view of a brick wall.
reviews.title: Affinia 50 experience

reviews.text: We returned to our room on our second night out on the town only to find that our room was not only unlocked but the door was left wide open. We are still doing inventory on personal items. The manager that responded to our complaint promissed a bottle of wine as compensation! This bottle of wine failed to reach us. Continental Breakfast? $17.00? A far better one is served for free at Motel 6. More to come on this...
reviews.title: Great stay at Affia 50

reviews.text: This time it was a quick shopping trip, so we were in and out. The suite really works for my family of five, and we love eating in that area. The hotel is so central to Manhattan. The hotel staff are so friendly and helpful. A huge help is they are preared to store our luggage after we have checked out so we can continue to enjoy the rest of the day.
reviews.title: Aging rooms, and barking dog in middle of night

reviews.text: I liked this place. It was clean. The presentation was nice. It is not fancy but it is acceptable. The rooms are nice but seem to be getting a bit lob in the tooth. The rugs a bit stained, the couches too. However, it is clear that the staff does clean after others make a mess. While not bad, it is still not perfect. The location is good, right across from Smith & Wolensky so you can get a great meal. Concierge is pleasant, and able to answer most questions. If you are looking for a decent room at a good decent price this is your hotel. Have fun. Enjoy the city.
reviews.title: Good hotel. More like an apartment in the suites.

reviews.text: We always stay at the Affinia 50 when we visit my son and his family in New York. Basically, we like the Affinia 50 because of the quality of the rooms, the friendly staff, and the great location. The excellent reviews are generally correct. However, one thing that is not usually mentioned is that the room rates can differ depending on the time of the year. If your are flexible with your dates you can save a considerable amount of money. My wife and I stay in a one bedroom suite when we are there. This suite can cost over $500 in December but the rate drops to just under $200 in January. The hotel also provides things like free high chairs if you are like us and entertaining a young grandchild.
reviews.title: Be Flexible With Your Dates And Save Money

reviews.text: Some reviews mentioned that sometimes the elevators are full when you have luggage and are trying to check out. Here is a trick I learned. Press both the up and down buttons. Get on the first one that has room. It may take a little longer to reach the lobby but at checkout time the elevators going up will usually not be full. It may take a little longer to reach the lobby but at least you won't have to watch one full elevator after another go by.
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.text: We always take Amtrak when we go to New York. If you can buy your tickets a couple of months in advance there are big savings to be had. You can always switch dates if you have a problem. When you leave New York, take a train the originates in New York and there will always be seats together. An Amtrak timetable book (free from any ticket agent)
reviews.title: A regular customer but this time problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: will tell you this.
reviews.title: Stay at Affinia 50 - Manhattan

reviews.text: Having been to New York before and stayed in various types of hotels, this tops them all and is definitely worth a visit.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Its location is great and means you can easily walk to most of the major sights. With 5th Avenue a block up this also makes shopping very easy. For sights a little further away (or if you don't like walking too far) tube statations are near by.
reviews.title: One of the best in NYC!

reviews.text: The rooms were exceptionally clean and the Aveda products in the bathrooms were a nice touch.
reviews.title: Smashing place

likes.disliked: — Tiny bit of noise from air con units

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you arrive at this hotel you are made to feel very welcome. The concierge guys were amazing and were always happy to help, as were the staff on reception.
reviews.title: Brilliant!!!!!

likes.liked: — our room and the great welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great value for money and a great stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Location !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice little hotel with a great location. The good: VERY comfortable beds and linens and a large enough room that we didn't feel cramped. Very clean.
reviews.title: Good (not outstanding) hotel in a nice location.
Loved Affinia 50!
reviews.text: The not-so-good: Street noise and noise from other guest rooms kept my husband from sleeping. (I am a sound sleeper, and would sleep through almost anything.)

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: We were able to get a reasonable weekend rate and at that rate I would consider the Affinia 50 a very good choice. At the usual daily rate, however, I would not recommend it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! This is a great hotel! a real hidden gem. Our room was huge and immaculate. I cannot say enough about the staff. The absolute friendliest and most accomodating staff I have encountered. From the minute I walked up to the door I was treated royally. The club floor is a great asset with 2 big flat screen tvs, lots of comfy couches and games, books, a coffee area etc. A real oasis in NYC. The best location..walked to bloomies, rockefeller center, times square, american girl etc etc. On mothers day i was handed a rose as i entered the lobby. Can't praise this hotel enough!!!
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.text: We stayed in a junior suite at the Affinia 50 for several days in May. The suite was very spacious - two beds, desk, couch, chair, ottoman - and nicely decorated. The bathroom was well-appointed and a nice size. The Aveda toiletries are a nice touch. There room included a small kitchen - the cabinets and appliances were pretty outdated, but it was nice to have a fridge. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in in a hotel. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Overall, a very good experience, and a good bargain, especially for New York.
reviews.title: Excellent Service & Smiles in NYC

reviews.text: We had some issues upon arriving -- our room had not been cleaned. After informing the front desk of the situation, we were upgraded to a penthouse (beautiful, comfortable). We had another problem later that night -- our lick didn't work. It was quickly fixed and our parking was comped to make up for the inconvenience.
reviews.title: Very helpful staff!

reviews.text: The staff responded to each of our issues perfectly. Great stay!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.text: Spent 5 days at the Affinia 50 in September. Everything from the friendly staff, the impeccable room and unbeatable location made our vacation. They have a club room on the second floor where we were able to spread out, relax and have a glass of wine at night. Coffee and tea was also free all day long! I took advantage of the free wireless here too. Although there is a cost in the rooms, I used the internet on the second floor every day at not cost. The hotel is within walking distance from the hustle & bustle of New York City. It's also a block away from the train.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, in some need of tlc

reviews.text: We'll definitely be back soon!
reviews.title: nice hotel great neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (family of 4) spent 5 nights here in Sept 2011, and had a great time. The staff were REALLY helpful - the courteous and entertaining doormen, Craig the excellent concierge, friendly reception staff - and the accommodation was excellent (one bedroom suite - larger than expected, and very well appointed). On the less positive side, the room needed updating - some lights didn't work, the kitchen was a bit grubby, and some flakey plaster on the carpet remained untidied throughout our stay. Also, the sofa-bed was not as comfortable (or as large) as it should have been.
reviews.title: First New York Visit

reviews.text: GOOD STUFF
reviews.title: Very Good Stay

reviews.text: Location -- Midtown, within three blocks of two subway stations. Also great bus services for all directions.
reviews.title: Excellent service, great location

likes.disliked: — Lighting in room could have been slightly better.

reviews.text: Beds -- Me, hubby,and teenage daughters had two queen size beds. (Other hotels have doubles, not queens.) Beds were very comfortable with crisp bedding.
reviews.title: Nice NYC stay

reviews.text: Rooms -- Having a small kitchen (full size fridge, microwave etc.) was wonderful. Stored dinner leftovers, bottled wine, desserts, snacks, milk, and take out food from Pax and Azure. Lots of TV stations including one HBO. Lots of storage space, even a cupboard in the bathroom. Not bothered by the noise even though we faced the street on the 6th floor. Yes there are sirens,trash trucks, honking horns etc. But that's what you get in any city. (We live in the country so we're more alert to man-made noises.)
reviews.title: great stay as well as location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Freebies -- Wine and cheese in the 2nd level lounge (between 6-7pm) was a treat, especially before heading to the theatre. Copy of Time Out New York in the Lobby.
reviews.title: Couldn't have hoped for more

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with 4 girlfriends sight unseen. We were so pleased with our suite, it was very large and comfortable. The staff is incredible, the best customer service possible. The doormen, especially Steve who worked later in the day were great. They always had a smile for us and would welcome us back. We were in a great location in a nice neighbourhood and the price was great too. The little diner down the street was incredible and we ate there at least 4 times. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We will defintely stay there again.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: My fiancé and I were in NYC for the marathon and found the Affina 50 to be a great location. It was near the 51st and Lex subway station. 50th street is quiet and there was a great club downstairs. The beds were very comfortable and the hotel gave you a choice of pillows. The price was reasonable for downtown Manhattan. The staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location for the Marathon

reviews.text: We stayed in a guest room, so there was just a refrigerator and a coffee pot. We had a room on the fifth floor that was quiet, but no view. Monday through Thursday on the 2nd floor, the hotel hosts a wine and cheese reception from 6-7 PM. The 2nd floor has two large rooms with comfortable couches and chairs to sit and talk.
reviews.title: Loved the Affinia 50

reviews.text: Internet wise, each room has a high speed connection and on the 2nd floor there are two computers where you can purchase time.
reviews.title: first class stay
Friendly, clean and spacious
reviews.text: Stayed here for 6 nights last week in a studio suite at about $350 per night plus taxes. Great room with bathroom, kitchenette and two double beds. Room 807 - very quiet, clean and with all the amenities you would expect. Staff very helpful and friendly. Location superb as my conference was at the Waldorf Astoria where rooms were described as expensive and tired. No bar or restaurant but a very good buffet breakfast ($15) in the common rooms on the second floor - a good healthy option compared with the local diners. My colleague was given a noisy room on the second floor at first but was relocated to the eighteenth floor the next night. I suspect you need to check in early to get the best rooms. Would definitely stay here again for midtown vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and really friendly staff especially the doormen.
reviews.title: What a great place

likes.disliked: — Lack of a bar or proper restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were extremely clean,comfortable, beautifully decorated and excellent value for the location. We could walk every where although there are subways all around the hotel. Lovely Club Room where you can get a continental breakfast but there are plenty of places to eat nearby. Would be good if there was a bar also the reception is quite small and has limited seating while waiting for your car.We would return the hire car for our NY stay and then pick another up again if heading further afield. Transfers to airports are easy.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I've stayed in two Affinia properties (the Dumont & 50), and both are outstanding values. Location is good (more "neighborhoody"), rooms are large and nicely furnished with multiple seating areas and small kitchens.
