We were in NYC the weekend of the April Nor'Easter (8" of rain on Sunday!) and it was great to have a kitchen for our bagels (skip the overpriced breakfast in the "lounge") and more room to spread out and read the Times while the rain raged outside.
reviews.title: Great place for frequent business trips

likes.disliked: — Growing tired of room service menu

reviews.text: Just a couple of quibbles - the elevators can be really slooooww sometimes, and service from the front desk staff can be a little spotty - tried calling them 3 times from the room and no one ever picked up. Overall, we'll certainly stay with Affinia again.
reviews.title: Nice place

likes.disliked: — The A/C not working well at ALL

reviews.title: What a Warm Welcome!
reviews.text: We stayed here with our 2 1/2 year old Nov. 23-27 in a junior suite in room 1701.
centrally located, nice size room especially for nyc. 2 queen beds and extra space in the room. The employees were very cordial. I would stay her again.
reviews.title: great choice

reviews.text: This hotel exceeded expectations. The staff were amazing and very friendly, willing to help with directions and assistance with restaurants. The room was spacious and clean. Most frustrating thing was only having wifi in the lounge area, while the lounge area was homely not the best for a quick reference. Would recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a good location

reviews.text: My husband, myself and the kids just stayed here for a week. I am not sure how many stars it is but by australian standard I would give it 3.5. The location of this hotel is fabulous, you are so close to everything. The staff were all very nice and helpful. The bed was very comfortable, i did like the coffee machine in the room. There is a laundry in the basement which was excellent. The downside of this hotel is not having a restaurant, although there is a lot and of restaurants close by it would have been great to have that option. The room service that was available is from Mint across the road, I must say it was terrible, the food was so average and overpriced. The hotel should do itself a favour and maybe get the room service from another restaurant. They do offer breakfast during the week which is toast, pastries and fruit. I would recommend people to stay here as it is clean, comfy bed and close to most things, but do not stay here if you normally stay at 4.5 or 5 star hotels. We stayed on the 19th floor and you can here the traffic but it was not a problem but you do here sirens mostly every night.
reviews.title: Recent stay at Affania 50

reviews.text: I have a family of 4 with a 9 year old and a 12 year old. My primary objective for our recent trip to NY was not as much location as it was to have sleeping space.....IE bigger beds. I found the Affinia 50 was one of the only hotels I could find that had two QUEEN beds in the room. The room greatly exceeded our expectations. Our room had a small kitchen with a fridge, stove top, microwave and toaster with all the dishes, pots and pans to cook a simple meal. There was also a desk, and two closets in our room including a built in unit in one wall that kept our luggage off the floor. (a big plus to me as I am fearful of bedbugs when I travel)
reviews.title: Excellent property for families

reviews.text: The hotel employees were extremely friendly......ranging from the doorman greeting us when we returned each evening with "welcome home, family" to the front desk personnel giving us restaurant advice. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to Rockefeller Center and about 15 minutes from times square. Their is a subway station two minutes away and the next stop south of that one is Grand Central Station. The bathroom was small, but that is to be expected in New York, and is plenty for one person to get ready at a time. It was our first time to stay at this property, but I can say I will not hesitate to book there again the next time we are in town.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel in the perfect location

reviews.text: What a fantastic surprise! We needed to book a room at the last minute and called this hotel based on other trip advisor recommendations. Everything they say is true! The amazing part was that we had actually stayed here when it was Plaza Fifty. The Affinia has done a great job renovating the hotel. It is very clean and comfortable. Modern and Sleek design with great customer service. We couldn't have been more pleased and would absolutely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Loved this hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is excellent, a real gem. You will not go wrong selecting this hotel. It is located in an excellent location close to all attractions in New York City. Moreover, it is located a stones throw from many restaurants and the hotel stafff are more than capable of directing guests to excellent eateries within a short distance from the hotel. The doormen were outstanding and all the hotel staff were great. We were in room 1905 and could barely hear the traffic below. This hotel made our Thanksgiving memorable.
We stayed at the Affinia 50 for 5 nights with our two kids the week before Thanksgiving. Most of the staff was fairly young but they were very nice and always EXTREMELY helpful.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Affinia 50
Terrific
reviews.text: We had a room with 2 queen beds. The room was really a very nice size with plenty of extra space and good closet and drawer space and a nice size tv. There was also a small kitchenette which we didn't really use, but liked the full size frig (I hate those tiny hotel refrigerators filled with so much stuff they want you to buy you can't even keep a bottle of water cold!). The only negative was that the bathroom was fairly small, especially for 4 people, but we managed.

description: Affinia 50 is currently undergoing a complete redesign of all guest rooms and suites as well as its public spaces (corridors, lobby and second floor club room). The newly redesigned Affinia 50 Will be completed at the end of November 2013. Affinia 50 hotel has 251 beautifully redesigned rooms including 100 with kitchens and 19 with terraces. All with eclectic furnishings that look hand-selected; curated details at every corner and well-considered design down to the last, elegant component. New to the lobby is a grab-and-go retail space featuring food, beverages, sundries and fun, curated merchandise for spur-of-the-moment splurges. The redesign connects the lobby and the Club Room via a sweeping, stainless steel-and-stone staircase to an updated oasis. The design of the second floor Club Room inspires guests to get out of their rooms with an inviting, eclectic mix of modern furniture and stylish accent pieces where they can relax, work and take advantage of complimentary Wi-Fi. Each evening the hotel hosts a complimentary wine hour held in the Club Room and breakfast is served here daily. Set in the dynamic center of Midtown Manhattan - Affinia 50 provides a modern, artfully designed setting with a residential feel. Close proximity to Rockefeller Center – Fifth Avenue shopping and corporate headquarters makes Affinia 50 an appealing choice for a wide range of business travelers, couples, and international guests.
